metadata.title: CVE-2018-10841 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.description: glusterfs is vulnerable to privilege escalation on gluster server nodes. An authenticated gluster client via TLS could use gluster cli with --remote-host command to add it self to trusted storage pool and perform privileged gluster operations like adding other machines to trusted storage pool, start, stop, and delete volumes. It was discovered that GlusterFS incorrectly handled user permissions. An authenticated attacker could possibly use this to add himself to trusted storage pool and performing privileged operations on volumes.

criterions.comment: glusterfs package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.1.2-1').
